Useful links

Freshman Orientation Sign Up - credit card and student SDSUID required
Housing - step-by-step instructions on how to apply for university housing
Map of campus - interactive resource for locating buildings, parking structures, etc.
Student Account Services - make a payment for basic tuition & fees



Student Portals
(these require student's SDSUID to log in)

AidLink - AidLink is a secure online system that gives students 24-hour access to their SDSU
                                       financial aid records and SDSU scholarship application(s). Where students activate
                                       and manage documents for grants, financial aid and loans.
Canvas - Canvas serves as the primary learning management system for SDSU. Faculty can post
                                       course content, recorded lectures, YouTube videos, discussions, grades, tests and
                                       more. See IT Services for more information.
Get Card (SDSUCard) - manage your money, order food, do laundry & more!
Handshake - allows students to more easily connect with employers and search for jobs, internships,
                                       event information, and on-campus recruiting opportunities
IT Services - your student can use their SDSUID to securely access many campus IT services and is their single identifier to access
                                       all IT services, workstations/devices, and labs at SDSU. Password management is self-service
                                       and recoverable through a variety of options, all selected and managed by the student.
Parking - students and guests can purchase permits, pay citations, and appeal citations.
                                       Please make sure you have your vehicle information prior to purchasing a permit as
                                       it will be required the first time you register in the portal.
Web Portal - Admission status check, class schedule and registration, transcripts, official
                                       contact information.



Where to suggest your student turn first, if the issue is:

A roommate ...Resident Assistant (RA) or Residence Hall Coordinator in the hall
Personal ...Counseling & Psychological Services
A cold or flu ...Student Health Services
Selecting a major ...Office of Advising and Evaluations or Career Services
Changing a major ...Office of the Registrar or academic department
Study skills ...Counseling & Psychological Services or Academic Advising Center
Trouble with a class ...First, course instructor; then, department office
Trouble with a course instructor ...Department chair or Office of the Student Ombudsman
Food/meal plans ...Aztec Shops student meal planEmail: [email protected]
Changing an address ...Student address: Student’s Web PortalAccount parent address: email [email protected] or call 619-594-1653
Applying for scholarships ...Office of Financial Aid and Scholarships
Finding employment ...Career Services
Residency classifications ...Office of the Registrar
Involvement opportunities, joining a club or organization ...Student Life & Leadership
